thread.title: Seidel: Lions go throwback, 'chuck it deep' to Megatron
thread.title_full: Seidel: Lions go throwback, 'chuck it deep' to Megatron

title: Seidel: Lions go throwback, 'chuck it deep' to Megatron
persons: Julian H. Gonzalez/Detroit Free Press Kirthmon F. Dozier
Julian H. Gonzalez/Detroit Free Press Julian H. Gonzalez
text: Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Seidel: Lions go throwback, 'chuck it deep' to Megatron Matthew Stafford and Calvin Johnson connected on six completions for 166 yards and a touchdown in the win over Chicago Post to Facebook Seidel: Lions go throwback, 'chuck it deep' to Megatron Matthew Stafford and Calvin Johnson connected on six completions for 166 yards and a touchdown in the win over Chicago Check out this story on Freep.com: http://on.freep.com/1RR5y9M Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Seidel: Lions go throwback, 'chuck it deep' to Megatron Jeff Seidel, Detroit Free Press Columnist 3:28 a.m. EDT October 19, 2015 Detroit Lions fans celebrate the overtime win against the Chicago Bears Sunday, October 18, 2015 at Ford Field in Detroit. Julian H. Gonzalez, DFP Detroit Lions kicker Matt Prater boots the game-winning field goal in overtime to beat the Chicago Bears, 37-34, on Sunday, October 18, 2015, in Detroit. Julian H. Gonzalez, DFP Detroit Lions Golden Tate gives a slap of the hand to Calvin Johnson as they walk off the field after their 27-24 overtime win over the Chicago Bears on Sunday, October 18, 2015, in Detroit. Julian H. Gonzalez/Detroit Free Press Kirthmon F. Dozier, DFP Detroit Lions head coach Jim Caldwell argues the intentional grounding penalty against Matthew Stafford in the fourth quarter against the Chicago Bears on Sunday, October 18, 2015, in Detroit. Gonzalez/Detroit Free Press Julian H.
